## Leveraging LLMs

- [**Retrieval/Context Augmented Generation**]{.orange} (RAG/CAG) vs [**fine-tunning**]{.orange}

- [**2 possibilities**]{.orange}:
  1. [**RAG**]{.blue2}
    - [**Unstructured prior knowledge**]{.green2} based on similarity of notes embeddings
  2. [**CAG**]{.blue2}: 
    - [**Structured prior knowledge**]{.green2} based on known mappings

- üí° Core idea ‚û°Ô∏è Provide key information to the LLM to translate NAF 2008 into 2025

::: {.callout-warning}
RAG can act like a zero-shot classifier, while CAG is not a classifier as it relies on prior knowledge.
:::

## Output Validation

- LLMs tend to be overly [**verbose**]{.orange}
- Responses shaped into [**structured**]{.orange}, minimal format
- JSON is the preferred schema.
